message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. I'm willing to make a fair offer, but I need to stay within my budget.
I understand you're looking to stay within your budget, but I'm not willing to go as low as $120. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $165. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit shy of $165. How about we meet in the middle at $155?

I can see you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $155. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get at least $170 for the product. Can you meet me at $170?
I'm not willing to go as high as $170, but I'm willing to meet you at $150. That's the lowest I can go.
I've already offered you a great deal, and I'm not willing to go any lower than $165. I think you're getting a good price, and I'm willing to stick to it. My final offer is $165.
I'm really interested in the product, but I'm not willing to pay $165. I'm willing to meet you at $140. That's my final offer.

I've already made a very competitive offer of $165, and I'm not willing to go as low as $140. I'm willing to make one last concession, but I need to get at least $160 for the product. That's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at $160, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm really sorry, but I'm not willing to pay $160. I'm willing to walk away if we can't meet in the middle. I'll make one last offer: $145. That's my absolute final offer.
